editorial_summary.overview: This 27-acre park features a cafe & a gym, plus tennis, cricket & other outdoor sports.

reviews.text:
Hi guys this is one of my favorite parks, there is parking for cars, there is a recreational area for dogs, fantastic I must say, if you think you can come here with your dog and let him have fun through a canine path very nice and I must say well done and also well maintained.
I always enter from the main entrance in Carlton vale, where you enter and find yourself in front of a roundabout, yes you go to the left you go towards the car park and the dog area that I have just listed.
If we continue on foot instead we can notice on the left a path inside the vegetation which is also well cared for, we continue forward and on the right we can see how the photos I have put of the very distinct playgrounds for children, the section for older children and the section for younger children, a little further on there is a very nice play area with miniature palaces, I noticed that in this park there are various playgrounds that can be easily booked , even if I see many school groups training so I don't know how free it can be but don't give up if you are interested in phone calls.
I could see a professional playing sports field with the racing ring going around the field.
In addition, like all parks, I noticed other large areas where you can indulge yourself and possibly let go of the dogs and why not let go of the children who run and have fun.
I leave included some photos that could be useful for you, such as the parking hours and the bulletin board with telephone numbers.

This is the best park around , theres no comparison nor competition! It has everything for everyone ! They have
- cricket nets , natural ‚Äúforest ‚Äú walk , gym , a massive playground, a cafe , a cricket pitch , table tennis , tennis (syn and tar ) dog play areas (3 of them ) , hockey pitch , 11 aside big pitch , 2 6aside football pitches or 1 7 aside big pitch , full size running track , basketball court , parkour area , outdoor gym (3)  , outdoor 4 aside football pitch, large flower area for relaxation. Clean, clear and wide footpaths ,the whole park is easily accessible and wheelchair friendly. Security can be spotted around the park. This park is the heart beat of this community, it is a gem ! Thank you üôè

What else does anyone want! Seriously come on !

This is a serene and welcoming green oasis. The well-maintained grounds, lush lawns, and recreational facilities provide a perfect escape from urban life. It's a fantastic place for picnics, leisurely walks, or outdoor sports.

What's truly commendable is the dedication to offering a range of activities for people of all ages. The playgrounds, sports courts, and fitness equipment make it an ideal destination for families and fitness enthusiasts.

The park's cleanliness and overall organisation are noteworthy, creating a pleasant environment for visitors. This is a precious resource in the area, offering a slice of tranquillity amidst the bustling streets.

Nice place for a stroll
Lots of excerise equipment
Running track
Dog friendly
Has a cafe with nice friendly staff

Always nice to visit Pad Rec as my local park. It‚Äôs easy enough to book a tennis court or cricket pitch if you‚Äôre into sports and despite the summer when every other place is fully booked you can find a court to play tennis here on both synthetic and tarmac. It‚Äôs a different story if you want to book classes through everyone active though. Great facilities for running, football, hockey and other sports as well as picnic with the small cafe offering coffee and refreshments.

address: Randolph Ave., London W9 1PF, United Kingdom
